## Interactive Map with Leaflet ##
 
```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(leaflet)
library(mapview)
library(htmltools)
library(leaflet.extras)
```

```{r}
iconbmsc <- awesomeIcons(
  icon = "circle",
  iconColor = '#FFFFFF',
  library = "fa",
  markerColor = "black")

iconbmscdock <- awesomeIcons(
  icon = "circle",
  iconColor = '#FFFFFF',
  library = "fa",
  markerColor = "red")

iconwestgov <- awesomeIcons(
  icon = "circle",
  iconColor = "#FFFFFF",
  library = "fa",
  markerColor = "red")

iconhealth <- awesomeIcons(
  icon = "circle",
  iconColor = "#FFFFFF",
  library = "fa",
  markerColor = "red")

compassicon <- makeIcon(
  iconUrl = "https://freesvg.org/img/CompassRose.png",
  iconWidth = 100, iconHeight = 100
)
```


```{r}
map <- leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addProviderTiles(providers$CartoDB.Positron) %>%
  addLabelOnlyMarkers(
    lng = -125.1346, lat = 48.83552,
    label = HTML("Bamfield Marine<br>Science Centre"),
    labelOptions = labelOptions(noHide = TRUE, textOnly = TRUE, direction = "right", 
                                style = list( 
                                  "color" = "black",
                                  "font-weight" = "bold",
                                  "font-size" = "10px", 
                                  "background" = "white",
                                  "padding" = "3px", 
                                  "border-radius" = "5px"
                                  ))) %>%
  addAwesomeMarkers(
    lng = -125.13543, lat = 48.83552,
    icon = iconbmsc) %>%
  addAwesomeMarkers(
    lng = -125.13674, lat = 48.83326,
    label = "BMSC South Dock",
    icon = iconbmscdock,
    labelOptions = labelOptions(noHide = TRUE, direction = "right",
                                style = list( 
                                  "color" = "black",
                                  "font-weight" = "bold",
                                  "font-size" = "10px", 
                                  "background" = "white",
                                  "padding" = "3px", 
                                  "border-radius" = "5px"))) %>%
  addAwesomeMarkers(
      lng = -125.13988, lat = 48.82896,
      label = "West Government Dock",
      icon = iconwestgov,
      labelOptions = labelOptions(noHide = TRUE, direction = "left",
                                  style = list( 
                                  "color" = "black",
                                  "font-weight" = "bold",
                                  "font-size" = "10px", 
                                  "background" = "white",
                                  "padding" = "3px", 
                                  "border-radius" = "5px"))) %>%
  addAwesomeMarkers(
      lng = -125.13719, lat = 48.82711,
      label = "Island Health Dock",
      icon = iconhealth,
      labelOptions = labelOptions(noHide = TRUE, direction = "right",
                                  style = list( 
                                  "color" = "black",
                                  "font-weight" = "bold",
                                  "font-size" = "10px", 
                                  "background" = "white",
                                  "padding" = "3px", 
                                  "border-radius" = "5px"))) %>%
  addScaleBar(
    map,
    position = "topright"
  )
scaleBarOptions(
  maxWidth = 100,
  metric = TRUE,
  updateWhenIdle = TRUE
)
map
```

```{r}

```

## Static Map with ggplot ##

```{r setup2, include = FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(sf)
library(rnaturalearth)
library(rnaturalearthdata)
library(ggspatial)
library(cowplot)
library(ggrepel)
library(rnaturalearthhires)
library(maptiles)
```

```{r world map setup}
Bamfield <- data.frame(name = "Study Area", lon = -125.14078, lat = 48.83336)
Bamfield_sf <- st_as_sf(Bamfield, coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326)

bam_coords <- st_coordinates(Bamfield_sf)
bam_point_df <- data.frame(x=bam_coords[,1], y = bam_coords[,2])
```

```{r world map}
world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf")

world_map <- ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = world, fill = "gray90", color = "gray50") +
  geom_point(data = bam_point_df, aes(x=x, y=y), shape = 0, color = "black", size = 3, stroke = 1) +
  theme_void() +
  annotation_scale(location = "bl", width_hint = 0.3, line_width = 0.5, text_cex = 0.7) +
  annotation_north_arrow(location = "tl", which_north = "true", style = north_arrow_orienteering, width = unit(1, "cm"), height = unit(1, "cm"), pad_x = unit(0.25, "cm")) +
  coord_sf(xlim = c(-170, -50), ylim = c(-60, 80)) +
  ggtitle("a) study site location (world map)")
```

```{r bamfield map setup}
sites <- data.frame(
  name = c("a)", "b) ", "c)"),
  lon = c(-125.13674, -125.13988, -125.137045),
  lat = c(48.833226, 48.82869, 48.82711)
)

sites_sf <- st_as_sf(sites, coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326)

bbox <- st_bbox(sites_sf)
bbox_expanded <- bbox
bbox_expanded["xmin"] <-bbox["xmin"] - 0.002
bbox_expanded["xmax"] <-bbox["xmax"] + 0.002
bbox_expanded["ymin"] <- bbox["ymin"] - 0.002
bbox_expanded["ymax"] <- bbox["ymax"] + 0.002

bbox_expanded_sfc <- st_as_sfc(bbox_expanded)

basemap <- get_tiles(x = bbox_expanded_sfc, provider = "Esri.WorldGrayCanvas", crop = TRUE, zoom = 15)
```

```{r}
bamfield_map <- ggplot() +
  layer_spatial(basemap) +
  geom_sf(data = sites_sf, aes(color = name), size = 4) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data = sites, 
    aes(x = lon, y = lat, label = name), 
    size = 4,
    nudge_y = 0.0004
    ) +
  coord_sf(
    expand = FALSE) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue", "green", "purple"), labels = c("BMSC South Dock", "West Government Dock", "Island Health Dock")) +
  annotation_scale(location = "bl", width_hint = 0.25) +
  annotation_north_arrow(location = "tl", which_north = "true",
                         style = north_arrow_fancy_orienteering) +
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude", title = "b) sample sites", color = NULL) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "right", 
    panel.grid.major = element_blank()
  )
```

```{r}
world_map + bamfield_map + plot_layout(ncol = 2, widths = c(2, 1.3))
```
